I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. The church is losing followers, and this is partly because it is not very accepting of many things. 

For example, the church has strong views on topics like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. While these views are okay, they are a bit old-fashioned. If the church were to change its ideas to be more modern, it would not lose so many followers.

Many people do not agree with the church's views on these subjects. They see the church's opinions as wrong. The church is against abortion, and people who support abortion may not feel comfortable in a church that says it is wrong. The same is true for gay marriage and other issues.

I don't see why priests cannot be married or have women priests. The church says that priests are married to God, but I do not see why they cannot have a family and be devoted to both their job and their family.

It is hard to say if this would have prevented problems in the church. But it seems fair that priests should be able to have a family life like everyone else. They have a job, but they also have their own life. I do not see why they cannot be devoted to both God and their family.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people are born gay. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for who they are.

I don't think it is right that two people of the same sex cannot get married. It is not fair to say this. I haven't given the issue a lot of thought, but I think it is wrong.

I believe that people cannot choose who they are attracted to. If someone is born straight, they are straight. If someone is born gay, they are gay. It is not a choice.

I don't think the federal government should be involved in this issue. It is not a question of law or morality. It is just who people are. They should not be judged or punished for it.

The federal government should not interfere in people's personal lives. This issue is not related to the security of our country. It is simply a matter of treating people with respect and kindness.

People should be free to be who they are. We should not punish them for that.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized. There is no good reason why it shouldn't be.

Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to the traditional family. But this is not true. They are a different kind of family, not the same as traditional families.

There are many rights that come with marriage, like property taxes and health care. If a gay couple gets married, their partner can be with them in the hospital and visit them when they are sick. This is a basic right.

Science shows that gay couples are no different from straight couples. They have the same rates of success and the same factors that make a relationship happy.

The problem is that some people object to gay marriage because they don't want to allow it in their churches. But the government should not be involved in this. A marriage is a legal document, not a church ceremony.

If the government allows civil unions, why not marriage? It's the same thing. It's like segregation - separate but unequal.

People worry about adoption and how gay couples will affect their communities. But these are not good reasons. Every family is different, and gay families are no exception. They can be good parents just like straight couples.

Some people say that children of gay parents will be hurt by their parents' choices. But there is no evidence for this. Children of gay parents can be happy and well-adjusted just like children of straight parents.

The government should make gay marriage legal in every state. The federal government should not interfere with this issue. The President has his own views, but they are based on his religion and not on what is fair and equal for all.

It's not fair to ignore the culture and morality of many Americans and impose one group's views on the rest. The government should not make laws based on one group's religious standards.

Some people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are psychologically damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. We should listen to experts, not just our friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some people think that because a drug is against the law, it cannot be good for us. I do not agree. I think it is not good to make marijuana available for the public. However, I believe it is good to use it for medical purposes. 

Many medicines we use in pharmacies are against the law. For example, oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocets. These medicines help people feel better. If we do not allow people to use marijuana because it is against the law, we are not using its good effects. 

Some people think that marijuana and alcohol are the same. But they are different. If you use too much marijuana or too much alcohol, you can have problems. I think it is not good to make marijuana legal all at once. We should remove the bad idea people have about marijuana first. Then, people might use it responsibly. 

People have a bad idea about marijuana because it is against the law. It is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. If we change our idea about marijuana, people might use it responsibly.

I think the church has changed to fit the 21st century. It's not as strict as it used to be. I used to go to church every Sunday when I was young. I got dressed up in nice clothes and shoes. But now, they have a special service for teenagers that is only 30 minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. They come in beach clothes. Even at morning services, people wear jeans and khakis. The church has become more casual.

The biggest change I've seen is this. I don't know much about the church's government, but this is what I've noticed.

Regarding the problems with Catholic priests and pedophilia, I don't think getting rid of men as priests or allowing them to marry would have stopped these problems. Some men who are married are still pedophiles. It's not because of the rules about marriage that they behave this way. When people choose to become priests, it's their choice. Some other religions allow their leaders to be married. If someone wants to be married and follow their faith, they can choose a different faith.

I think being a pedophile is due to genetics. People are either born that way or they're not. It's not something that someone becomes because of their upbringing. I don't think the church could have prevented these problems, even if they had tried. If they knew about the problems and tried to hide them, that's wrong. But I don't think they always knew.

I am very unhappy about the way the United States went to war in Iraq.  After the September 11th attacks, the country was still in shock. The Bush administration used the attacks as an excuse to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but that was not true.

The administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, the former Secretary of State, said he was not sure about the evidence when he presented it at the United Nations. This is not acceptable. It is a serious mistake for government officials to lie to the people.

The Bush administration has shown no respect for the United States Constitution. They have tried to limit its power since September 11th. They wanted to go to war from the beginning.

One of the former government officials wrote that President Bush wanted to go to war because of a personal reason. He wanted to punish Saddam Hussein because his father was unhappy with him. The president also wanted to control Iraq's oil.

I think the war has lasted too long. But if we leave now, there may be more violence and many more people will die. The United Nations and the United States are trying to find a way to end the war. They may ask other countries in the area to help restore order. However, this may cause more problems in the long run.

The Iraqi government is not working well. The Parliament is not effective, and the Prime Minister does not have much power. There are many groups fighting for control of the government. This is causing problems for the country.

I do not have a solution to these problems. I just know that the situation is very complicated.

I have an opinion about the War in Iraq. I think it is not a good idea. We did not declare war, but we are still fighting. I believe it started because Iraq did something bad to the United States. They did the 9/11 attack. Now, we are staying in Iraq to help them become a democracy. We also want their oil. But this is not a good reason to stay. It makes many people unhappy. 

If we stay, it will take a long time to build a democracy. And when we leave, they will be angry with us. They will have to start over and rebuild their country. 

I do not know much about the War in Iraq. I think it is hard to say yes or no. Some people's children are fighting in the war. I want the war to end so they can come home. But then I think about the people in Iraq who have lost their homes and their schools. They are in danger because of the different groups fighting each other. 

I am worried that if we stay, we will try to make Iraq like the United States. This will make things worse for them. They will be angry with us, and their hatred for the U.S. will grow. We will be trying to change a government that has been a dictatorship for a long time. 

I think this war will go on for a long time. It is a very complex issue.

I do not think it is right for a state to make a law that is against what a person's church believes. This is because the United States Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This means the government should not control what the churches say is right or wrong.

I think the Constitution makes it clear that the government should not try to make rules for the churches. If the government does this, it will be against the Constitution. I don't think it is fair to pick one church's beliefs over another. For example, many Catholics and Christians do not agree with this thing. But some areas, like Boston, do agree.

The separation of church and state has been important in the United States for a long time. It has allowed people to practice their own religion freely. The government should not try to make an amendment to change this. It would be wrong and go against what is already written in the Constitution.

I also think this amendment would be the only one that would keep people from doing what they want. It would not limit the government, but the people. I don't think this is fair.

I don't think the federal government should be involved in this issue. The president wants to make a new law because of his own personal beliefs. But this would be unfair to other people who do not share his beliefs. The churches should decide what is right or wrong, not the government.

There is no good reason for this new law except for the president's personal views. It will not help the economy, and it might even make things better in society.

I think I have said everything I want to say.

The war in Iraq. The American government did not tell the people the truth about the reasons for the war. They said it was connected to the attacks on September 11th, but that was not true. The government used the people's anger to make them want to go to war. 

In 2003, the US invaded Iraq. I do not believe in war. I think it is not right to make a preemptive attack. The US government should not have done this. 

The war in Iraq is like the war in Vietnam. The US government should have learned from its mistakes. Many American soldiers died in the war. The US removed the Iraqi government without being prepared for the problems that would come after. They wanted to put a democratic government in its place. But this was difficult. The US should have known that it would be hard. 

The US government should have planned for all the things that could happen after the war. They were not prepared. Many American soldiers are still in Iraq, and many are dying. The US is trying to train the Iraqi army and police to control their own country. This takes a long time. 

The US government made the people think the war would be easy and short. But it is not easy to create a new government. It takes years. In the US, it took a long time to create a strong democracy. There was a lot of trouble and a civil war. 

This decision to go to war in Iraq was hard. I was thinking about this in the 2004 election. I thought about voting for President Bush because he started the war, and it was hard to stop it. But then I thought, we cannot just leave the people of Iraq. We took their government and their way of life away. How can we leave them now? 

The US is risking a lot of American lives to make a democratic Iraq. But I do not think it is right to risk so many lives just for oil. The US government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. We know North Korea has these weapons, and we do not attack them. I do not think the US government is honest in its decisions.

I hope the war in Iraq ends soon and there is peace. But I do not think that will happen soon.

I am for gay marriage. I have always been. I think it's a personal choice and not something that should be decided by others. Studies show that it may be caused by biology, not how we are raised. I don't think it's right to give people fewer rights because of something they cannot control.

I don't think governments or politics should decide this issue. It's a personal matter that happens in a family or neighborhood. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who are like any other family. They take care of their children and live normal lives.

The government should not try to decide what marriage means. I think it's ridiculous for politicians to try to change the definition of marriage. Many experts say that being gay may be caused by a chemical in the brain. It's not because of how someone is raised or their family.

If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it privately. But if two gay people want to get married, it's a public issue. I think marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

I don't think it's right to deny people the right to marry because of their sexual preference. It's a personal choice and not something that should be controlled by the government.

When you put something on the internet, it's public. It can be seen by many people. This is a problem I've dealt with as a Resident Advisor (R.A.). 

When you put something online, it can affect how people think of you. If you talk about violence or shootings, people will react. You cannot control what others think or say. 

The internet is like a big public place. Many people see what you write. If you're friends with someone on a website like Myspace, you might see what they post. But the school can't control what you write. Someone might tell the school about a problem. They have to act on it.

It's hard to know what to believe because some people just joke around. But what happened was that someone overheard a conversation at school. They told the school about it. When they looked at a student's Facebook page, they found things that could be taken seriously. The student thought they were jokes, but they became serious.

When you post things online, you have no control over who sees them. If you don't want people to know something, don't post it. You can't tell people what to think or believe.

School officials shouldn't be friends with students on social media. They shouldn't read their messages or look at their pictures. But if someone tells them about a problem, they have to take it seriously. 

It's not right for teachers to make fake social media accounts to watch their students. That's not their job. As a R.A., I don't want to see my residents' personal things online. I don't want to have to deal with it.

I think the war has lasted too long. At first, I thought the goal was good - to bring democracy to another country. But now, I'm not sure. We may be fighting just to prove we are powerful.

I do not think the reasons for starting the war were clear. Perhaps it was connected to a disagreement between George Bush's father and Saddam Hussein. If the goal was to give democracy to a country without a fair system, that would be a good reason. But if personal issues were involved, it would not be good.

I think we made our point in the beginning. But the war has gone on for many years. It's time to end it.

If we wanted to give democracy to a country ruled by a tyrant, that would be a good reason for war. But I don't think that's what we're doing now. It seems we are at war because we want to be at war.

I think it's time to stop. The government of that country should take care of itself. We have our own problems, like poverty and bad roads, that we should be spending money on. We are spending billions of dollars on war when we could use that money to help our own people.

War is not something we should be doing in the long term. We have many problems at home that need our money. Our own citizens are fighting and dying in this war, and I don't think it's worth it.

I think that's all I want to say.

I have a question. Is it right to have someone look at students' online profiles to prevent a problem? 

Well, you see, if you post information on the internet, you can't really know who will see it. For example, on Myspace, you have to be friends with someone to see their profile. But when you accept someone as your friend, you're giving them permission to see your information.

When you put something on the internet, you have to understand that many people will see it. So, if someone found information that helped prevent a problem, I think that's good.

However, it's a complicated issue. We can't have someone looking at everyone's online profiles all day to prevent problems. That would be like treating some students unfairly. They might look at the students who they think are more likely to cause trouble.

But, it depends on the situation. If someone was looking for a reason to worry, it's not right. They should not be looking at profiles just to find something to be worried about.

I have a Facebook account. I know there are people who might see things about me that I don't want them to know. I saw a TV show about a man who showed how easily he could get information about someone online. He went onto a girl's profile and got her screen name in just a minute. He even tricked her into meeting with him.

It's hard to know who can see your online information. They might know your interests, what you look like, where you are, and who your friends are. They can even see pictures of you. I tried to limit what I post online, but it's hard to keep some things private.

The problem is that the internet is meant for communication, but it's not always private. So, it's a tricky issue.

I heard that my roommate's school once had a rule against students having Myspace accounts. I didn't think that was right. How can school officials tell students what they can and can't do online? It's a complicated issue that I'm not really sure about.

I want to talk about the Iraq War. It is a difficult thing to talk about. I feel bad saying what I am about to say. I was against the war from the beginning. I don't want to join the group of people who say "I was against it from the start." But now, it's not important anymore. Everyone agrees it was a bad idea. The government does not want to admit they made a mistake.

If we look at the polls, we can see that 75 to 80 percent of the world thinks the war was a bad idea. This includes 80 percent of Iraqis and 70 percent of U.S. troops in Iraq. They think we should leave within a year.

The war has been a disaster since the start. It was a disaster before we entered Iraq. Now, pulling out will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East. The United States and the Middle East have different cultures. This makes it hard for us to understand each other.

We thought we could bring democracy to Iraq, but this is not how the people of Iraq wanted to live. Saddam Hussein was a bad leader, but we should have thought about the pros and cons before invading Iraq.

We should listen to the Iraqis and leave. They want us to go. If we listen to them, we will not be responsible if things get worse. We can still help Iraq after we leave. This way, we will not be seen as the bad guys in the Middle East.

We should leave Iraq now. We can leave gradually over a year or a little longer if we want. I just don't see a reason to stay any longer. Most Iraqis want us to leave within a year, and some want us to leave now. We are trying to help them, but they are telling us to go. They might know better than us.

If we ask the Iraqis if we should leave, and they say yes, then we are not responsible if things get worse. We can be the good guys again. We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but at least we will be better than where we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It is not only women who face this issue, but also people in certain jobs or industries.

It is hard for women to be in high positions because of the "glass ceiling". This means that even if they are qualified, they may not be chosen for a job. This is because people are used to men being in charge.

Not only women, but also men face this problem. For example, in the fashion industry, men who like fashion are often not taken seriously. People may think, "How can you know about fashion if you're a man?" They may not understand that men can also be interested in fashion.

It is also a problem for men who want to stay at home and take care of their children. People may think, "You're a man, you should be working." This can be hard for men who want to spend time with their families.

To change this, it takes time. We have made progress, but it is slow. We need to keep working to make society understand that men and women are equal. As more women become successful in business and men stay home to care for their children, society is starting to accept these changes.

We should not force change, but instead show people the good qualities of those who are often discriminated against. If we do it too fast, people will resist. We need to find a balance and let change happen naturally.

Another problem is that people from different places may be discriminated against. For example, someone from a farm may not speak well, but they are very intelligent and can be a good leader. Other people may look down on them because of the way they speak.

So, to sum up, gender discrimination is a big problem in the United States. It affects both men and women in different ways. We need to keep working to make society understand that everyone is equal.

I think they did not make marijuana legal. 
They made it not a crime. 
It used to be a crime, but now it's not as serious. 
You can get a ticket for it instead of being arrested and put in jail. 
This means you do not have to go through all the trouble and expense of an arrest and court case. 
But even if you get a ticket, it can still affect you in the future. 
For example, it can affect how people see you when you try to get a job. 
But some people think that making marijuana not a crime saves money. 
It costs a lot to arrest and put people in jail. 
Then the government has to pay for the court case and lawyers. 
If a community is short of money, they might not want to make marijuana not a crime. 
But in Denver, people are more open-minded. 
They think it's okay to make marijuana not a crime. 
This means they have more money to spend on things like education and helping the homeless. 
I think this is a good idea. 
Marijuana is not something we want to be everywhere. 
But making it not a crime helps the community financially. 
Other reasons we might not want marijuana to be everywhere are that people might smoke it and drive. 
Some people think it is still wrong to smoke marijuana. 
They do not want it to be out in the open. 
I think it would be awkward for many people if marijuana was sold in stores like cigarettes. 
Alcohol can be bad for people's ability to drive and make decisions. 
Marijuana can also be bad for people's lifestyles. 
But different people react to substances in different ways. 
Some people can handle them well, and some people cannot. 
So it is hard to say how marijuana will affect people. 
I think both marijuana and alcohol can be bad for people. 
But people can use them in different ways.

I think yes. 
Because 
Many things in the Catholic Church are old ways of doing things. 
They have done things in the same way for a long time. 
This is good, because tradition is important. 
But it is also important to change sometimes. 

I think many Catholics believe they must go to church every week. 
They are very strict about how things are done. 
Sometimes I think the Catholic Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules exactly. 
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. 
They also do not accept people of other religions. 

For example, my parents could not get married in the Catholic Church because my father was not a Catholic. 

I think this is not very tolerant. 
We learned to love others in the Catholic Church. 
This is a good teaching. 
But it is not fair to say to love others and then not accept them. 

I do not think that making priests able to get married would make a difference. 
I think some people who do bad things, like hurting children, would do that anyway. 
It is not the same as having a spouse. 

I do not think allowing priests to be married would stop bad things from happening. 
I think these things would happen anyway.

I am not sure about this issue. I do not have a clear opinion. Both sides have good and bad points. But this is a very difficult problem. It is hard to decide what is right and what is wrong. 

Something important is the idea of separating church and state. And defining marriage is hard to do without hurting anyone's feelings. I do not know what to think. 

I think governments should look at civil unions. A civil union is when two people agree to be together. This is what marriage is. It is two people who want to be together. Governments should not ask if their marriage is a "sacrament" or not. They should not ask about their church. 

If two people are married, they should have the same rights. They should not be treated differently because of who they are. 

The issue of gay marriage is also important. If two people love each other, they should be able to get married. What is important is that they are happy and love each other.

If all states can agree on this issue, it should be made into a law for the whole country. But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is not necessary. This is a small issue. It does not need to be in the constitution.

This is a simple idea. Marriage is between two people who love each other. It is not about what the government says.

I was raised in a Christian home. But I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle. However, I think it should be legal. It is not a national issue. Each state should decide.

Some states are democratic and some are republican. Democratic states are more likely to approve gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know how the state feels about this issue. I do not think you can disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there, so you should accept the state's decision.

I think homosexuals should have the same rights as heterosexuals. Therefore, it should be up to each state to decide if they want to legalize gay marriage. I do not agree with the ban on gay marriage.

I do not think the president should decide for all states. President Bush does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state runs itself. Some things should be left up to each state. He will be out of office in a few years. A new president may decide to lift the ban. It is better to leave it up to each state. They will have to live with their decision, not the president.

No, I do not think that.

I don't agree with the idea of the school officials going on the internet to search for students. Myspace is a public website where people can post messages for others to see. If a student posts something on Myspace, it's like posting a sign on their wall for everyone to see.

The school officials have the right to know if students are doing things that can hurt themselves or others. If they see something that can help them keep the school safe, that's okay. They want to make sure students are safe, just like parents do.

When you post something on the internet, people can see it, including school officials. They can even find old posts from years ago. This is why I think it's okay for school officials to check the internet for things that can help them keep the school safe.

If school officials check the internet to see if students are doing bad things, it's not an invasion of privacy. They are trying to make the school a better and safer place for everyone. This is like what teachers and police do when they check the internet to prevent bad things from happening.

I think it's a good idea for school officials to check the internet to make sure the school is safe. They can prevent things like school shootings from happening. This is what they did in this case, and it's a good thing.

I'm not saying they should just go on the internet to catch students. But if it helps keep the school safe, that's okay. School officials are like the parents of the school. They want to keep everyone safe.

I'm not worried about what I post on the internet. If I say something bad about someone, I wouldn't say it on the internet. But if I do, it's not a big deal. It's like putting a sign on your wall for everyone to see.

The school officials were just trying to keep the school safe, like they do during drills for emergencies. They want to prevent bad things from happening, like the Columbine school shooting.

That's my opinion.

I have changed my mind about the war. At first, I was for it. I was affected by 9/11 and wanted to help. But I think we made a mistake. We went to war without a plan, and it did not work. We did not think about the long-term effects.

Now I am against the war. I do not think it helped anything. The people in the country we were fighting could not fight with each other, so why should we be there? We went there to help, but we only created more problems.

I do not care about what happens in that country. I think they are using war as a way to get rid of us, not to make their country better. I think we should leave and let them handle their own problems.

We were not prepared for war. We did not know what we were getting into. War is different for them than it is for us. They fight with no rules, and they are not trying to make their country better. We went to war seeking revenge, not thinking about the consequences.

I think President Bush declared war on Iraq because the people wanted it. He made a decision, but it was not a good one. We should have had a plan before we went in.

We did not have unity in our plan. We did not know what we were doing or what we wanted to achieve. We created more problems instead of solving them. I do not think we can change the people in that country. They will always be like that.

I do not think we are making progress. We have made some progress, but not enough to stay in the country. If we leave, the country will fall apart. We are hurting ourselves by staying there. We cannot stay forever, so it is time to go.

I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. The church is losing followers, and this is partly because it is not very accepting of many things. 

For example, the church has strong views on topics like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. While these views are okay, they are a bit old-fashioned. If the church were to change its ideas to be more modern, it would not lose so many followers.

Many people do not agree with the church's views on these subjects. They see the church's opinions as wrong. The church is against abortion, and people who support abortion may not feel comfortable in a church that says it is wrong. The same is true for gay marriage and other issues.

I don't see why priests cannot be married or have women priests. The church says that priests are married to God, but I do not see why they cannot have a family and be devoted to both their job and their family.

It is hard to say if this would have prevented problems in the church. But it seems fair that priests should be able to have a family life like everyone else. They have a job, but they also have their own life. I do not see why they cannot be devoted to both God and their family.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people are born gay. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for who they are.

I don't think it is right that two people of the same sex cannot get married. It is not fair to say this. I haven't given the issue a lot of thought, but I think it is wrong.

I believe that people cannot choose who they are attracted to. If someone is born straight, they are straight. If someone is born gay, they are gay. It is not a choice.

I don't think the federal government should be involved in this issue. It is not a question of law or morality. It is just who people are. They should not be judged or punished for it.

The federal government should not interfere in people's personal lives. This issue is not related to the security of our country. It is simply a matter of treating people with respect and kindness.

People should be free to be who they are. We should not punish them for that.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized. There is no good reason why it shouldn't be.

Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to the traditional family. But this is not true. They are a different kind of family, not the same as traditional families.

There are many rights that come with marriage, like property taxes and health care. If a gay couple gets married, their partner can be with them in the hospital and visit them when they are sick. This is a basic right.

Science shows that gay couples are no different from straight couples. They have the same rates of success and the same factors that make a relationship happy.

The problem is that some people object to gay marriage because they don't want to allow it in their churches. But the government should not be involved in this. A marriage is a legal document, not a church ceremony.

If the government allows civil unions, why not marriage? It's the same thing. It's like segregation - separate but unequal.

People worry about adoption and how gay couples will affect their communities. But these are not good reasons. Every family is different, and gay families are no exception. They can be good parents just like straight couples.

Some people say that children of gay parents will be hurt by their parents' choices. But there is no evidence for this. Children of gay parents can be happy and well-adjusted just like children of straight parents.

The government should make gay marriage legal in every state. The federal government should not interfere with this issue. The President has his own views, but they are based on his religion and not on what is fair and equal for all.

It's not fair to ignore the culture and morality of many Americans and impose one group's views on the rest. The government should not make laws based on one group's religious standards.

Some people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are psychologically damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. We should listen to experts, not just our friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some people think that because a drug is against the law, it cannot be good for us. I do not agree. I think it is not good to make marijuana available for the public. However, I believe it is good to use it for medical purposes. 

Many medicines we use in pharmacies are against the law. For example, oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocets. These medicines help people feel better. If we do not allow people to use marijuana because it is against the law, we are not using its good effects. 

Some people think that marijuana and alcohol are the same. But they are different. If you use too much marijuana or too much alcohol, you can have problems. I think it is not good to make marijuana legal all at once. We should remove the bad idea people have about marijuana first. Then, people might use it responsibly. 

People have a bad idea about marijuana because it is against the law. It is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. If we change our idea about marijuana, people might use it responsibly.

I think the church has changed to fit the 21st century. It's not as strict as it used to be. I used to go to church every Sunday when I was young. I got dressed up in nice clothes and shoes. But now, they have a special service for teenagers that is only 30 minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. They come in beach clothes. Even at morning services, people wear jeans and khakis. The church has become more casual.

The biggest change I've seen is this. I don't know much about the church's government, but this is what I've noticed.

Regarding the problems with Catholic priests and pedophilia, I don't think getting rid of men as priests or allowing them to marry would have stopped these problems. Some men who are married are still pedophiles. It's not because of the rules about marriage that they behave this way. When people choose to become priests, it's their choice. Some other religions allow their leaders to be married. If someone wants to be married and follow their faith, they can choose a different faith.

I think being a pedophile is due to genetics. People are either born that way or they're not. It's not something that someone becomes because of their upbringing. I don't think the church could have prevented these problems, even if they had tried. If they knew about the problems and tried to hide them, that's wrong. But I don't think they always knew.

I am very unhappy about the way the United States went to war in Iraq.  After the September 11th attacks, the country was still in shock. The Bush administration used the attacks as an excuse to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but that was not true.

The administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, the former Secretary of State, said he was not sure about the evidence when he presented it at the United Nations. This is not acceptable. It is a serious mistake for government officials to lie to the people.

The Bush administration has shown no respect for the United States Constitution. They have tried to limit its power since September 11th. They wanted to go to war from the beginning.

One of the former government officials wrote that President Bush wanted to go to war because of a personal reason. He wanted to punish Saddam Hussein because his father was unhappy with him. The president also wanted to control Iraq's oil.

I think the war has lasted too long. But if we leave now, there may be more violence and many more people will die. The United Nations and the United States are trying to find a way to end the war. They may ask other countries in the area to help restore order. However, this may cause more problems in the long run.

The Iraqi government is not working well. The Parliament is not effective, and the Prime Minister does not have much power. There are many groups fighting for control of the government. This is causing problems for the country.

I do not have a solution to these problems. I just know that the situation is very complicated.

I have an opinion about the War in Iraq. I think it is not a good idea. We did not declare war, but we are still fighting. I believe it started because Iraq did something bad to the United States. They did the 9/11 attack. Now, we are staying in Iraq to help them become a democracy. We also want their oil. But this is not a good reason to stay. It makes many people unhappy. 

If we stay, it will take a long time to build a democracy. And when we leave, they will be angry with us. They will have to start over and rebuild their country. 

I do not know much about the War in Iraq. I think it is hard to say yes or no. Some people's children are fighting in the war. I want the war to end so they can come home. But then I think about the people in Iraq who have lost their homes and their schools. They are in danger because of the different groups fighting each other. 

I am worried that if we stay, we will try to make Iraq like the United States. This will make things worse for them. They will be angry with us, and their hatred for the U.S. will grow. We will be trying to change a government that has been a dictatorship for a long time. 

I think this war will go on for a long time. It is a very complex issue.

I do not think it is right for a state to make a law that is against what a person's church believes. This is because the United States Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This means the government should not control what the churches say is right or wrong.

I think the Constitution makes it clear that the government should not try to make rules for the churches. If the government does this, it will be against the Constitution. I don't think it is fair to pick one church's beliefs over another. For example, many Catholics and Christians do not agree with this thing. But some areas, like Boston, do agree.

The separation of church and state has been important in the United States for a long time. It has allowed people to practice their own religion freely. The government should not try to make an amendment to change this. It would be wrong and go against what is already written in the Constitution.

I also think this amendment would be the only one that would keep people from doing what they want. It would not limit the government, but the people. I don't think this is fair.

I don't think the federal government should be involved in this issue. The president wants to make a new law because of his own personal beliefs. But this would be unfair to other people who do not share his beliefs. The churches should decide what is right or wrong, not the government.

There is no good reason for this new law except for the president's personal views. It will not help the economy, and it might even make things better in society.

I think I have said everything I want to say.

The war in Iraq. The American government did not tell the people the truth about the reasons for the war. They said it was connected to the attacks on September 11th, but that was not true. The government used the people's anger to make them want to go to war. 

In 2003, the US invaded Iraq. I do not believe in war. I think it is not right to make a preemptive attack. The US government should not have done this. 

The war in Iraq is like the war in Vietnam. The US government should have learned from its mistakes. Many American soldiers died in the war. The US removed the Iraqi government without being prepared for the problems that would come after. They wanted to put a democratic government in its place. But this was difficult. The US should have known that it would be hard. 

The US government should have planned for all the things that could happen after the war. They were not prepared. Many American soldiers are still in Iraq, and many are dying. The US is trying to train the Iraqi army and police to control their own country. This takes a long time. 

The US government made the people think the war would be easy and short. But it is not easy to create a new government. It takes years. In the US, it took a long time to create a strong democracy. There was a lot of trouble and a civil war. 

This decision to go to war in Iraq was hard. I was thinking about this in the 2004 election. I thought about voting for President Bush because he started the war, and it was hard to stop it. But then I thought, we cannot just leave the people of Iraq. We took their government and their way of life away. How can we leave them now? 

The US is risking a lot of American lives to make a democratic Iraq. But I do not think it is right to risk so many lives just for oil. The US government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. We know North Korea has these weapons, and we do not attack them. I do not think the US government is honest in its decisions.

I hope the war in Iraq ends soon and there is peace. But I do not think that will happen soon.

I am for gay marriage. I have always been. I think it's a personal choice and not something that should be decided by others. Studies show that it may be caused by biology, not how we are raised. I don't think it's right to give people fewer rights because of something they cannot control.

I don't think governments or politics should decide this issue. It's a personal matter that happens in a family or neighborhood. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who are like any other family. They take care of their children and live normal lives.

The government should not try to decide what marriage means. I think it's ridiculous for politicians to try to change the definition of marriage. Many experts say that being gay may be caused by a chemical in the brain. It's not because of how someone is raised or their family.

If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it privately. But if two gay people want to get married, it's a public issue. I think marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

I don't think it's right to deny people the right to marry because of their sexual preference. It's a personal choice and not something that should be controlled by the government.

When you put something on the internet, it's public. It can be seen by many people. This is a problem I've dealt with as a Resident Advisor (R.A.). 

When you put something online, it can affect how people think of you. If you talk about violence or shootings, people will react. You cannot control what others think or say. 

The internet is like a big public place. Many people see what you write. If you're friends with someone on a website like Myspace, you might see what they post. But the school can't control what you write. Someone might tell the school about a problem. They have to act on it.

It's hard to know what to believe because some people just joke around. But what happened was that someone overheard a conversation at school. They told the school about it. When they looked at a student's Facebook page, they found things that could be taken seriously. The student thought they were jokes, but they became serious.

When you post things online, you have no control over who sees them. If you don't want people to know something, don't post it. You can't tell people what to think or believe.

School officials shouldn't be friends with students on social media. They shouldn't read their messages or look at their pictures. But if someone tells them about a problem, they have to take it seriously. 

It's not right for teachers to make fake social media accounts to watch their students. That's not their job. As a R.A., I don't want to see my residents' personal things online. I don't want to have to deal with it.

I think the war has lasted too long. At first, I thought the goal was good - to bring democracy to another country. But now, I'm not sure. We may be fighting just to prove we are powerful.

I do not think the reasons for starting the war were clear. Perhaps it was connected to a disagreement between George Bush's father and Saddam Hussein. If the goal was to give democracy to a country without a fair system, that would be a good reason. But if personal issues were involved, it would not be good.

I think we made our point in the beginning. But the war has gone on for many years. It's time to end it.

If we wanted to give democracy to a country ruled by a tyrant, that would be a good reason for war. But I don't think that's what we're doing now. It seems we are at war because we want to be at war.

I think it's time to stop. The government of that country should take care of itself. We have our own problems, like poverty and bad roads, that we should be spending money on. We are spending billions of dollars on war when we could use that money to help our own people.

War is not something we should be doing in the long term. We have many problems at home that need our money. Our own citizens are fighting and dying in this war, and I don't think it's worth it.

I think that's all I want to say.

I have a question. Is it right to have someone look at students' online profiles to prevent a problem? 

Well, you see, if you post information on the internet, you can't really know who will see it. For example, on Myspace, you have to be friends with someone to see their profile. But when you accept someone as your friend, you're giving them permission to see your information.

When you put something on the internet, you have to understand that many people will see it. So, if someone found information that helped prevent a problem, I think that's good.

However, it's a complicated issue. We can't have someone looking at everyone's online profiles all day to prevent problems. That would be like treating some students unfairly. They might look at the students who they think are more likely to cause trouble.

But, it depends on the situation. If someone was looking for a reason to worry, it's not right. They should not be looking at profiles just to find something to be worried about.

I have a Facebook account. I know there are people who might see things about me that I don't want them to know. I saw a TV show about a man who showed how easily he could get information about someone online. He went onto a girl's profile and got her screen name in just a minute. He even tricked her into meeting with him.

It's hard to know who can see your online information. They might know your interests, what you look like, where you are, and who your friends are. They can even see pictures of you. I tried to limit what I post online, but it's hard to keep some things private.

The problem is that the internet is meant for communication, but it's not always private. So, it's a tricky issue.

I heard that my roommate's school once had a rule against students having Myspace accounts. I didn't think that was right. How can school officials tell students what they can and can't do online? It's a complicated issue that I'm not really sure about.

I want to talk about the Iraq War. It is a difficult thing to talk about. I feel bad saying what I am about to say. I was against the war from the beginning. I don't want to join the group of people who say "I was against it from the start." But now, it's not important anymore. Everyone agrees it was a bad idea. The government does not want to admit they made a mistake.

If we look at the polls, we can see that 75 to 80 percent of the world thinks the war was a bad idea. This includes 80 percent of Iraqis and 70 percent of U.S. troops in Iraq. They think we should leave within a year.

The war has been a disaster since the start. It was a disaster before we entered Iraq. Now, pulling out will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East. The United States and the Middle East have different cultures. This makes it hard for us to understand each other.

We thought we could bring democracy to Iraq, but this is not how the people of Iraq wanted to live. Saddam Hussein was a bad leader, but we should have thought about the pros and cons before invading Iraq.

We should listen to the Iraqis and leave. They want us to go. If we listen to them, we will not be responsible if things get worse. We can still help Iraq after we leave. This way, we will not be seen as the bad guys in the Middle East.

We should leave Iraq now. We can leave gradually over a year or a little longer if we want. I just don't see a reason to stay any longer. Most Iraqis want us to leave within a year, and some want us to leave now. We are trying to help them, but they are telling us to go. They might know better than us.

If we ask the Iraqis if we should leave, and they say yes, then we are not responsible if things get worse. We can be the good guys again. We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but at least we will be better than where we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It is not only women who face this issue, but also people in certain jobs or industries.

It is hard for women to be in high positions because of the "glass ceiling". This means that even if they are qualified, they may not be chosen for a job. This is because people are used to men being in charge.

Not only women, but also men face this problem. For example, in the fashion industry, men who like fashion are often not taken seriously. People may think, "How can you know about fashion if you're a man?" They may not understand that men can also be interested in fashion.

It is also a problem for men who want to stay at home and take care of their children. People may think, "You're a man, you should be working." This can be hard for men who want to spend time with their families.

To change this, it takes time. We have made progress, but it is slow. We need to keep working to make society understand that men and women are equal. As more women become successful in business and men stay home to care for their children, society is starting to accept these changes.

We should not force change, but instead show people the good qualities of those who are often discriminated against. If we do it too fast, people will resist. We need to find a balance and let change happen naturally.

Another problem is that people from different places may be discriminated against. For example, someone from a farm may not speak well, but they are very intelligent and can be a good leader. Other people may look down on them because of the way they speak.

So, to sum up, gender discrimination is a big problem in the United States. It affects both men and women in different ways. We need to keep working to make society understand that everyone is equal.

I think they did not make marijuana legal. 
They made it not a crime. 
It used to be a crime, but now it's not as serious. 
You can get a ticket for it instead of being arrested and put in jail. 
This means you do not have to go through all the trouble and expense of an arrest and court case. 
But even if you get a ticket, it can still affect you in the future. 
For example, it can affect how people see you when you try to get a job. 
But some people think that making marijuana not a crime saves money. 
It costs a lot to arrest and put people in jail. 
Then the government has to pay for the court case and lawyers. 
If a community is short of money, they might not want to make marijuana not a crime. 
But in Denver, people are more open-minded. 
They think it's okay to make marijuana not a crime. 
This means they have more money to spend on things like education and helping the homeless. 
I think this is a good idea. 
Marijuana is not something we want to be everywhere. 
But making it not a crime helps the community financially. 
Other reasons we might not want marijuana to be everywhere are that people might smoke it and drive. 
Some people think it is still wrong to smoke marijuana. 
They do not want it to be out in the open. 
I think it would be awkward for many people if marijuana was sold in stores like cigarettes. 
Alcohol can be bad for people's ability to drive and make decisions. 
Marijuana can also be bad for people's lifestyles. 
But different people react to substances in different ways. 
Some people can handle them well, and some people cannot. 
So it is hard to say how marijuana will affect people. 
I think both marijuana and alcohol can be bad for people. 
But people can use them in different ways.

I think yes. 
Because 
Many things in the Catholic Church are old ways of doing things. 
They have done things in the same way for a long time. 
This is good, because tradition is important. 
But it is also important to change sometimes. 

I think many Catholics believe they must go to church every week. 
They are very strict about how things are done. 
Sometimes I think the Catholic Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules exactly. 
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. 
They also do not accept people of other religions. 

For example, my parents could not get married in the Catholic Church because my father was not a Catholic. 

I think this is not very tolerant. 
We learned to love others in the Catholic Church. 
This is a good teaching. 
But it is not fair to say to love others and then not accept them. 

I do not think that making priests able to get married would make a difference. 
I think some people who do bad things, like hurting children, would do that anyway. 
It is not the same as having a spouse. 

I do not think allowing priests to be married would stop bad things from happening. 
I think these things would happen anyway.

I am not sure about this issue. I do not have a clear opinion. Both sides have good and bad points. But this is a very difficult problem. It is hard to decide what is right and what is wrong. 

Something important is the idea of separating church and state. And defining marriage is hard to do without hurting anyone's feelings. I do not know what to think. 

I think governments should look at civil unions. A civil union is when two people agree to be together. This is what marriage is. It is two people who want to be together. Governments should not ask if their marriage is a "sacrament" or not. They should not ask about their church. 

If two people are married, they should have the same rights. They should not be treated differently because of who they are. 

The issue of gay marriage is also important. If two people love each other, they should be able to get married. What is important is that they are happy and love each other.

If all states can agree on this issue, it should be made into a law for the whole country. But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is not necessary. This is a small issue. It does not need to be in the constitution.

This is a simple idea. Marriage is between two people who love each other. It is not about what the government says.

I was raised in a Christian home. But I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle. However, I think it should be legal. It is not a national issue. Each state should decide.

Some states are democratic and some are republican. Democratic states are more likely to approve gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know how the state feels about this issue. I do not think you can disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there, so you should accept the state's decision.

I think homosexuals should have the same rights as heterosexuals. Therefore, it should be up to each state to decide if they want to legalize gay marriage. I do not agree with the ban on gay marriage.

I do not think the president should decide for all states. President Bush does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state runs itself. Some things should be left up to each state. He will be out of office in a few years. A new president may decide to lift the ban. It is better to leave it up to each state. They will have to live with their decision, not the president.

No, I do not think that.

I don't agree with the idea of the school officials going on the internet to search for students. Myspace is a public website where people can post messages for others to see. If a student posts something on Myspace, it's like posting a sign on their wall for everyone to see.

The school officials have the right to know if students are doing things that can hurt themselves or others. If they see something that can help them keep the school safe, that's okay. They want to make sure students are safe, just like parents do.

When you post something on the internet, people can see it, including school officials. They can even find old posts from years ago. This is why I think it's okay for school officials to check the internet for things that can help them keep the school safe.

If school officials check the internet to see if students are doing bad things, it's not an invasion of privacy. They are trying to make the school a better and safer place for everyone. This is like what teachers and police do when they check the internet to prevent bad things from happening.

I think it's a good idea for school officials to check the internet to make sure the school is safe. They can prevent things like school shootings from happening. This is what they did in this case, and it's a good thing.

I'm not saying they should just go on the internet to catch students. But if it helps keep the school safe, that's okay. School officials are like the parents of the school. They want to keep everyone safe.

I'm not worried about what I post on the internet. If I say something bad about someone, I wouldn't say it on the internet. But if I do, it's not a big deal. It's like putting a sign on your wall for everyone to see.

The school officials were just trying to keep the school safe, like they do during drills for emergencies. They want to prevent bad things from happening, like the Columbine school shooting.

That's my opinion.

I have changed my mind about the war. At first, I was for it. I was affected by 9/11 and wanted to help. But I think we made a mistake. We went to war without a plan, and it did not work. We did not think about the long-term effects.

Now I am against the war. I do not think it helped anything. The people in the country we were fighting could not fight with each other, so why should we be there? We went there to help, but we only created more problems.

I do not care about what happens in that country. I think they are using war as a way to get rid of us, not to make their country better. I think we should leave and let them handle their own problems.

We were not prepared for war. We did not know what we were getting into. War is different for them than it is for us. They fight with no rules, and they are not trying to make their country better. We went to war seeking revenge, not thinking about the consequences.

I think President Bush declared war on Iraq because the people wanted it. He made a decision, but it was not a good one. We should have had a plan before we went in.

We did not have unity in our plan. We did not know what we were doing or what we wanted to achieve. We created more problems instead of solving them. I do not think we can change the people in that country. They will always be like that.

I do not think we are making progress. We have made some progress, but not enough to stay in the country. If we leave, the country will fall apart. We are hurting ourselves by staying there. We cannot stay forever, so it is time to go.
